Dispute_Type: Patent ownership and rights to sell
Legal_Issue: Whether Novopharm is entitled to protection under s. 56 of the Patent Act for enalapril maleate purchased before patent issuance
Evidence_Assessment: Delmar's certificate of analysis indicating product met specifications
Decision_Outcome: Novopharm is entitled to protection under s. 56; application dismissed
Credibility_Factor: Deliverability of the product on October 1, 1990, as indicated by certificate of analysis
Legal_Rule: Section 56 allows use and sale of invention if purchased or acquired before patent application becomes public
Procedural_Issue: Timing of purchase relative to patent issuance
Grounds_for_Claim: Merck claimed Novopharm infringed its patent by selling enalapril maleate
Review_Standard: Interpretation of statutory provisions and evaluation of transaction timing
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Fair opportunity to present evidence on timing and deliverability
Key_Evidence_Considered: Date of receipt (October 1, 1990), certificate of analysis
Applicant_Challenge: Merck sought to prohibit Novopharm from selling the product
Defendant_Response: Asserted protection under s. 56 due to pre-patent purchase
Remedy_Requested: Injunction to prevent sale by Novopharm
Outcome: No infringement; Novopharm may sell the product
